edge: The narrator, who dreams of becoming a photographer. His real name is Wilson Rodrigues.

Power-hungry sociopath, who takes sadistic pleasure in killing. As an adult, he is given the name Zé Pequeno in a Candomblé ceremony, which may be unrelated to his actual name and more to his short stature. Zé is a nickname for José, while pequeno means 'little'.
Zé's longtime partner in crime, he is a friendly City of God drug dealer who fancies himself a sort of Robin Hood, and eventually wants to lead an honest life.
A drug dealer who is friendly with Benny but is constantly threatened by Zé.

A handsome, charismatic gentleman. As a former veteran, he is an excellent shot and can shoot better than most of the 'soldiers'. His name was changed for the English subtitles because in English, 'chicken' is a term for a coward (in Brazil it denotes womanizing tendencies and popularity among women). 'Mané' is a nickname for Manuel, but also denotes an individual not intellectually gifted.
Shaggy's girlfriend, who convinces him to leave the favela and his criminal past.
Leader of the Tender Trio, a group of thieves who share their profits with the population of the City of God.
Shaggy's girlfriend, who convinces him to leave the favela and his criminal past.
Childhood friend of Rocket, portrayed by Emerson Gomes as a child.
Friend and love interest of Rocket, later Benny's girlfriend who motivates Benny to abandon the criminal life.
Angélica's ex-boyfriend who later becomes Li'l Zé's associate and a drug addict.
Weapons dealer supplied by the police who is later killed by the police after returning from a deal empty-handed.
Journalist for Jornal do Brasil who hires Rocket as a photographer.
Child leader of the Runts gang.
One of the Tender Trio, and Rocket's brother who sleeps with a bartender's wife and gets kicked out by his father when the police arrive, later killed by Li'l Dice.
Later gives up crime to join the Church.
